intro: Euphrasia nemorosa f. vernalis, commonly known as the spring euphrasia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Scrophulariaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant produces small, yellowish-orange flowers with five petals and a distinctive spurred structure. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. This botanical variant is noted for its early blooming habit, often appearing in late spring, contributing to its common name.
